trial_identification.studytitle: The Effect Of AVANDIA On The Late Asthmatic Response
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Randomised Double-blind Two-period Crossover Study to Investigate the Effect of Treatment With Repeat Doses of a PPAR Gamma Agonist on the Allergen-induced Late Asthmatic Response in Subjects With Mild Asthma Compared With Repeat Doses of Placebo

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - Rosiglitazone Treatment: drugs - Placebo
Experimental: Subjects receiving treatment 1 - Eligible subjects will receive rosiglitazone immediate release tablet with a dose of 4 milligrams twice daily administered orally for 28 days followed by placebo oral tablet.
Experimental: Subjects receiving treatment 2 - Eligible subjects will receive placebo oral tablet followed by rosiglitazone immediate release tablet with a dose of 4 milligrams twice daily for 28 days.
Treatment: drugs: Rosiglitazone Rosiglitazone will be given as immediate release tablet of 4 milligrams administered orally for 28 days.
Treatment: drugs: Placebo Subjects will also receive placebo oral tablet.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The effect of repeat oral doses of AVANDIA for 28 days on the late asthmatic response to inhaled allergen. Measured as lung function 4-10 hours after allergen challenge after 28 days dosing.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The early asthmatic response to allergen, bronchial challenge, nitric oxide, markers of inflammation and safety/tolerability.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
Inclusion criteria:
- Mild asthmatic treated with short-acting beta agonists only, non-smoker.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
Exclusion criteria:
- Inability to abstain from medications other than short-acting beta agonists and paracetamol.
- Recent administration of steroids.
- Recent respiratory infection or exacerbation of asthma.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study is to investigate the effects of AVANDIA on the asthmatic response.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: This study has not been published in the scientific literature.
